levelledPara.title: AFDX Bus System Overview
levelledPara.para: The Avionics Full-Duplex Switched Ethernet (AFDX) bus system provides deterministic, high-speed data communication between avionics systems in the BWB-Q100 aircraft. This data module describes the general architecture and capabilities of the AFDX implementation.

levelledPara.title: System Architecture
levelledPara.para: The AFDX network consists of dual-redundant networks (A and B), four AFDX switches, and multiple end systems. Each network operates independently at 100 Mbps using full-duplex switched Ethernet.

levelledPara.title: Virtual Links
levelledPara.para: Communication occurs via Virtual Links (VLs), which are logical unidirectional channels from one source to one or more destinations. Six primary VLs are configured for flight-critical, navigation, engine, and maintenance data.

levelledPara.title: Redundancy
levelledPara.para: Critical data uses dual-active redundancy, with frames transmitted on both networks simultaneously. The receiving system accepts the first valid frame and discards duplicates.
